list.name: Changes
list.comment:
This project explores publication trends in a booksdataset by analyzing how frequently a chosen keyword appears in book titles over time. Using a publicly available dataset of books, the analysis focuses on titles containing a specific keyword and examines how their publication frequency changes across years.
The project further divides these books into English-language and non-English-language groups to compare patterns between the two. The data is cleaned and filtered, and the results are visualized with side-by-side bar charts to highlight differences and trends across publication years.

task.summary: This project analyzes historic NYPD arrest data to compare yearly assault-arrest trends in Manhattan versus the other New York City boroughs. After cleaning the dataset and isolating all assault-related arrests, I grouped them by year and visualized the differences. The results show that while Manhattan consistently records fewer assault arrests than the rest of the city—largely due to population differences—the overall trends rise and fall in similar ways across boroughs. This suggests that citywide factors, rather than borough-specific ones, drive most year-to-year variation. Overall, the comparison highlights the importance of geographic context when interpreting crime data.

This project analyzes historic NYPD arrest data to compare yearly assault-arrest trends in Manhattan versus the other New York City boroughs. After cleaning the dataset and isolating all assault-related arrests, I grouped them by year and visualized the differences. The results show that while Manhattan consistently records fewer assault arrests than the rest of the city—largely due to population differences—the overall trends rise and fall in similar ways across boroughs. This suggests that citywide factors, rather than borough-specific ones, drive most year-to-year variation. Overall, the comparison highlights the importance of geographic context when interpreting crime data.

This project analyzes historic NYPD arrest data to compare yearly assault-arrest trends in Manhattan versus the other New York City boroughs. After cleaning the dataset, I grouped assaults by year and visualized the differences. The results show that while Manhattan consistently records fewer assault arrests than the rest of the city, the overall trends rise and fall in similar ways across boroughs.
